definition: to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: Cameroon Ministry of Communications has also ordered three companies of informal long-distance passenger business for rectification.
sentences.chinese: 喀交通部還勒令三家非正規長途客運公司停業整頓。

sentences.english: The next day, the unit will be ordered to suspend business for reorganization.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，該單位將被勒令停業整頓業務。

sentences.english: A number of securities companies were closed or temporary closed for reorganizing because of irregular operations.
sentences.chinese: 部分證券公司因違規經營被撤銷或停業整頓。

sentences.english: The Going-Out-of-Business Sale is, perhaps, the sale where one can get the biggest discounts.
sentences.chinese: “停業銷貨”可能是顧客可以獲得的最大的折扣。

sentences.english: The place or the document has been closed down on the spot, the case for further processing.
sentences.chinese: 該場所無證照，已被當場停業，案件在進一步處理中。

sentences.english: Police ordered the club to close its doors for 3 months and pay a fine of RMB20000 for the illegal practice, according to Xinhua.
sentences.chinese: 警方已責令該夜總會停業整頓3個月，罰款2萬元。

sentences.english: Closed for half a day for stocktaking.
Stores were closed, franchisees filed for bankruptcy and sales continued to fall.
sentences.chinese: 商店停業，加盟商申請破產，還有銷售量的持續下跌。

sentences.english: You will be out of business if you miss the green train.
sentences.chinese: 如果錯過了這列綠色列車，你必將停業。

sentences.english: This company has been stopped for an audit because of its messy management and tolerance of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司管理混亂藏污納垢，已經停業查辦了。

sentences.english: The small factory on the street closed down for lacking of materials.
sentences.chinese: 街道上的那家小工廠由於沒有原料而停業了。

sentences.english: The shops and warehouses are all closed.
Storefronts for exporters that have gone out of business are boarded up.
sentences.chinese: 出口商的店面因爲停業已經用木板封住。

sentences.english: He decided to close out his book store.
sentences.chinese: 他決定將他的書店停業。

sentences.english: The so-called "construction police" have twice disabled it by demolishing the staircases.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的“建設警察”已經兩次拆除樓梯迫使它停業。

sentences.english: The pub has been ordered to suspend business.
sentences.chinese: 涉案歌舞廳已被責令停業。

definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to ask sb to resign from a post
a building used as a factory/factory (building)/CL:座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
